Recipe.Title: Elixir of Fleeting Starlight
Recipe.Author: Lyra of the Silver Spire
Recipe.Purpose: Grants the imbiber the ability to perceive echoes of the recent past, lasting for a single lunar cycle. Useful for investigations and historical research.

Ingredients.Ingredient: Pure spring water, collected under a new moon

Procedure.Step: Gently heat the spring water in a silver cauldron. Do not allow it to boil, as this will agitate the temporal spirits within.
Dissolve the Powdered Moonstone while chanting the incantation of temporal sight, stirring counter-clockwise.
Carefully add the Crystallized Chronos Dust. The mixture will hiss and release a cool vapor.
Infuse the motes of starlight one by one. The mixture should shimmer with a faint, ethereal glow upon completion.
Decant into a crystal phial and allow it to cool in complete darkness for three nights before use.

Recipe.Notes: Warning: Consumption may lead to temporal disorientation or "time-sickness." Do not operate heavy scrying orbs or engage in chronomantic rituals after imbibing. Best used in a controlled environment.

Recipe.Title: Philosopher's Dew
Recipe.Author: Unknown
Recipe.Purpose: A preliminary agent for the minor transmutation of base metals. Primarily used to convert lead into tin as a proof of concept for the Magnum Opus.

Procedure.Step: Combine Quicksilver and vitriol in a sealed alembic under the sign of Mercury.
Apply slow, consistent heat for forty days and nights, observing the color phases from black (nigredo) to white (albedo).
Introduce the phoenix feather during the citrinitas (yellowing) phase. This will stabilize the reaction.
The final substance, a viscous, golden liquid, is the Philosopher's Dew. Handle only with enchanted tongs.
